home:
Welcome to Liars Anonymous!

Liars Anonymous is a fellowship of people who share their experience, strength and hope with each other that they may solve their common problem and help others to recover from dishonest tendencies.

The only requirement for membership is a desire to stop being dishonest. There are no dues or fees for L.A. membership; we are self-supporting through our own contributions. L.A. is not allied with any sect, denomination, politics, organization or institution; does not wish to engage in any controversy, neither endorses nor opposes any causes. Our primary purpose is to get honest, stay honest and help others do the same.

If you are having problems with lying and honesty and think you may be a compulsive liar, you have come to the right place. Liars Anonymous is here to help you. Many of us have come here out of crisis, a crisis that our dishonesty contributed towards. Either our family, personal relationship, work relationships or friendships were in shambles. We came here to get help. You are not alone and there is hope. Welcome.

commonQuestions:
Frequently Asked Questions

How do I get started?

Begin by attending an online meeting. Introduce yourself, listen, and share as honestly as you can. In time you may wish to ask someone to be your sponsor and work the Twelve Steps together.

How do I get a sponsor?

At the end of most meetings members who are available to sponsor identify themselves. You can also use our phone list—anyone marked ‘Sponsor-Available’ welcomes your call.

Do I have to sign up, and does this cost anything?

No sign-up forms, no dues, no fees. We are self-supporting through voluntary member contributions.

How do I book an appointment? What is your schedule?

You don’t need an appointment. Simply click the meeting link at the scheduled time. The full schedule is on the ‘Meeting Schedule’ tab.

Are there any in-person meetings in my area?

At present we meet exclusively online. If you’d like to start an in-person meeting, let us know—we can help.

I need help—what should I do right now?

Join the next available meeting or call someone on the phone list. You are not alone, and someone is always willing to listen.

I’m not religious and don’t believe in God. Will this still work for me?

Yes. The program is spiritual, not religious. ‘Higher Power’ can mean anything that helps you—nature, the group itself, or simply honesty.

Do I need a password to join the meeting?

Most meetings do not require a passcode. The LGBTQ+ meeting uses one for added privacy; it is posted next to the link.

My partner is a liar. Do you have a group for loved ones?

Yes. Our weekly Loved-Ones Support Group (Thursdays) is for anyone affected by another person’s dishonesty.

Am I too young, too old, or otherwise not the right fit?

Everyone who wants to stop lying is welcome, regardless of age, background, or identity. Please respect others’ experiences.

When did Liars Anonymous start?

The fellowship was founded on December 12, 2021.

How do I know if Liars Anonymous is right for me?

If lies—big or small—feel out of control, harm your relationships, or make you feel ashamed, you may find relief here. Only you can decide.

What happens in a typical meeting?

Meetings usually open with brief readings, followed by members sharing their experience, strength, and hope. Sharing is always voluntary—listening is enough. Meetings end with announcements and fellowship.

Is my anonymity protected?

We never record meetings, and members agree to keep what is shared confidential. Use only your first name—or a screen-name—if you prefer.
